sentences.en: Champagne wines became immensely popular in the 18th century.
sentences.cn: 香槟酒在18世纪十分流行。

sentences.en: Group discussion is also immensely helpful in convincing patients that they can choose a course that feels right to them.
sentences.cn: 小组讨论在让病人相信可以选择适合自己的疗程方面也能发挥巨大的作用。

sentences.en: He was an immensely likeable chap.
sentences.cn: 他是个极讨人喜欢的家伙。

sentences.en: He was immensely ambitious but unable to conceive of winning power for himself.
sentences.cn: 他雄心勃勃，但是想不出自己能如何赢得权力。

sentences.en: He was immensely attractive to women, onscreen and offscreen.
sentences.cn: 银屏内外的他都令女性为之倾倒。

sentences.en: He was not only talented but immensely popular with his colleagues.
sentences.cn: 他不仅才华横溢，而且深受同事的喜爱。

sentences.en: His only experience of gardening so far proved immensely satisfying.
sentences.cn: 到目前为止他唯一的一次园艺经历非常令人满意。

sentences.en: I found it immensely rewarding working with the less able children.
sentences.cn: 为能力差的孩子工作我觉得是非常值得的.

sentences.en: If you don't want to think about anything, just sit there silently and count your breaths - this will help you immensely as well.
sentences.cn: 如果你不愿意去想任何事，就默默坐在那里，数一下您的呼吸----这也将极大地帮助到你。

sentences.en: Sir James was an immensely distinguished architect in the vanguard of his profession.
sentences.cn: 詹姆斯爵士是一位非常杰出的建筑师，处于其专业领域的前沿位置。

sentences.en: The children were immensely diverted by his funny stories.
sentences.cn: 孩子们被他的幽默故事逗得乐不可支.

sentences.en: Wind surfing can be strenuous but immensely exciting.
sentences.cn: 风帆冲浪可能紧张吃力，但却非常刺激。

words.tran_cn: 巨大的，广大的；无边无际的；非常好的
极大地；无限地；广大地；庞大地

trans.tran_cn: 极大地，广大地，无限地，庞大地，〈口〉非常，很，“immense”的派生
